sections.heading: What is Plain Form + Noun?
sections.content:
Plain form + noun is the basic pattern for modifying nouns in Japanese. Verbs and adjectives must be in their plain (dictionary) form when directly modifying a noun - never the polite ます/です forms. This is the foundation of noun modification in Japanese.

食べる人 "A person who eats" 赤い車 "A red car" 昨日買った本 "The book (I) bought yesterday"

children.heading: [Plain form] + Noun
children.content: 読む + 本 → 読む本 "A book to read" 高い + 車 → 高い車 "An expensive car" Direct modification No particles between

children.heading: Dictionary form (present/future)
children.content: 食べる人 "A person who eats / will eat" 行く場所 "A place to go" Present or future action

children.heading: た-form (past)
children.content: 食べた人 "A person who ate" 行った場所 "A place (I) went" Past action

children.heading: ない-form (negative)
children.content: 食べない人 "A person who doesn't eat" 行かない場所 "A place (I) don't go" Negative action

children.heading: ている-form (continuous/state)
children.content: 走っている人 "A person who is running" 開いている店 "A store that is open" Ongoing state or action

children.heading: い-adjectives (plain form)
children.content: 高い山 "A tall mountain" 新しい本 "A new book" 白い犬 "A white dog" Direct modification

children.heading: な-adjectives (with な)
children.content: 静かな場所 "A quiet place" 便利な道具 "A convenient tool" きれいな花 "A pretty flower" な connects to noun

children.heading: Modifier before noun
children.content: [私が読んだ] 本 "[The book I read]" [昨日買った] 服 "[The clothes (I) bought yesterday]" Clause comes first Noun comes last

children.heading: ALWAYS use plain in modification
children.content: Wrong: 読みます本 ⚠️ Correct: 読む本 ✓ "A book to read" Never use polite form Even in polite sentences

children.heading: Main sentence can be polite
children.content: これは私が読んだ本です "This is the book I read" (polite) Modifier: plain (読んだ) Final verb: polite (です)

children.heading: Particles stay in modifier
children.content: 私が読んだ本 "The book that I read" が marks subject

children.heading: を for objects
children.content: 私が買った物 "The thing I bought" を can be omitted

children.heading: で/に for location
children.content: 東京にある店 "A store in Tokyo" 私が住んでいる家 "The house where I live" Location marked

children.heading: Present tense modifier
children.content: 食べる人 "A person who eats" Habitual or future

children.heading: Past tense modifier
children.content: 食べた人 "A person who ate" Completed action

children.heading: Stacking modifiers
children.content: 昨日私が買った新しい本 "The new book I bought yesterday" Multiple clauses possible All in plain form

children.heading: Order of modifiers
children.content: [Relative clause] + [Adjective] + Noun 彼が作った美味しい料理 "The delicious food he made" Clauses before simple adjectives

children.heading: Person descriptions
children.content: 日本語を話す人 "A person who speaks Japanese" メガネをかけている人 "A person wearing glasses" Identifying people

children.heading: Place descriptions
children.content: 静かな場所 "A quiet place" 人が多い店 "A store with many people" Location qualities

children.heading: Object descriptions
children.content: 私が好きな音楽 "Music that I like" 高くて美味しい料理 "Food that's expensive and delicious" Thing characteristics

children.heading: Time-related nouns
children.content: 彼が来た時 "The time when he came" 雨が降る日 "A day when it rains" Temporal modification

children.heading: が in relative clauses
children.content: 彼が書いた本 "The book that he wrote" 私が住んでいる町 "The town where I live" が preferred over は

children.heading: Context-based omission
children.content: Full: 私が食べたりんご "The apple I ate" Short: 食べたりんご "The eaten apple" Subject often dropped

children.heading: Shopping and choosing
children.content: これは昨日買った服です "These are the clothes I bought yesterday" 欲しい物がある "There's something I want" Describing items

children.heading: Introducing people
children.content: これは私が作った料理です "This is food I made" あの走っている人は友達です "That person running is my friend" Identification

children.heading: Making recommendations
children.content: 私がよく行くレストラン "A restaurant I often go to" 友達が教えてくれた場所 "A place my friend told me about" Suggestions

children.heading: Using polite forms
children.content: Wrong: 読みました本 ⚠️ Wrong: 高いです車 ⚠️ Correct: 読んだ本 ✓ Correct: 高い車 ✓ Must use plain

children.heading: Forgetting な with な-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 静か場所 ⚠️ Correct: 静かな場所 ✓ "A quiet place" な required

children.heading: Using は in relative clauses
children.content: Wrong: 私は読んだ本 ⚠️ Correct: 私が読んだ本 ✓ "The book I read" Use が, not は

children.heading: Adding の unnecessarily
children.content: Wrong: 赤いの車 ⚠️ Correct: 赤い車 ✓ "A red car" Direct modification No の needed

children.heading: ない-form before nouns
children.content: 食べない人 "A person who doesn't eat" 好きじゃない食べ物 "Food I don't like" Negative descriptions

children.heading: Long modifier clauses
children.content: 私が昨日図書館で借りた本 "The book I borrowed at the library yesterday" Full clauses possible All plain form

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 読む本 "A book to read" 高い車 "An expensive car" 静かな場所 "A quiet place" 食べた人 "A person who ate" 走っている人 "A person who is running"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 私が昨日買った新しい服はとても高かった "The new clothes I bought yesterday were very expensive" 彼が住んでいるアパートは駅から遠い "The apartment where he lives is far from the station" 母が作ってくれた料理を食べた "I ate the food my mother made for me" 日本語を勉強している友達がたくさんいます "I have many friends who are studying Japanese" 東京にある大きい店で買い物をした "I shopped at a big store in Tokyo"
